abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            unsatisfactory. Despite adequate identification of the
            beneficiary's technical requirements, the Bank failed
            to realistically assess Bangladesh Power Development
            Board's (BPDB) ability to improve its commercial and
            financial performance, in the absence of fundamental
            institutional changes. Cooperation was provided by the
            Borrower, such as submission of satisfactory reporting
            requirements. However, and in spite of timely counterpart
            funds' provision during implementation, BPDB's
            inability to generate additional funds, adversely affected
            the project outcome. The lessons drawn from the project
            suggest that: 1) although project requirements called for
            the separation of Dhaka Electric Supply Authority (DESA)
            from BPDB, provision for DESA's institutional
            development was not established, nor to finance its
            activities. This suggests that sufficient instruments should
            be ensured within project design, to improve the
            borrower's performance; 2) careful analysis of the
            overall sector should be considered, to avoid irreversible
            effects, caused by ad-hoc solutions; 3) implementation of
            physical components require management capabilities to
            overcome unpredictable issues, or predictable risks, and, 4)
            distribution system improvement projects should include, and
            properly coordinate, all developmental aspects, to
            adequately contain non-technical losses.

Bangladesh - Power Distribution (16 Towns)
            Project : Credit 2016 - Project Agreement - Conformed

docna.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Power Distribution (16 Towns)
            Project : Credit 2016 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Bangladesh - Power Distribution
            (16 Towns) Project : Credit 2016 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's main objectives are
            to: (i) expand and strengthen the Bangladesh Power
            Development Board's (BPDB) distribution systems in 16
            towns; (ii) stabilize system voltage, reduce power losses in
            the transmission and distribution system; and (iii)
            strengthen BPDB's organizational and institutional
            performance. Specifically, the project comprises erection of
            about 92 km of 33 kV lines, extension of low-voltage
            distribution networks in 16 towns, and procurement of spare
            parts for power stations and substations. The project also
            provides for the installation of capacitors and reactive
            compensation equipment and of meters and metering equipment.
            Finally, technical assistance and desk-top computers will be
            provided to BPDB.
